alert.note: Alert for Hoopa; Lower Middle Klamath; North Coast; Trinity; Upper Smith; Van Duzen, Mad River (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 23 at 1:26PM PDT until August 25 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WITH ABUNDANT LIGHTNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT... .An upper level low will bring the chance for thunderstorms to Trinity, eastern Humboldt, western Siskiyou, and Del Norte counties Thursday afternoon into the first half of the overnight. Thunderstorms will be moving to the north-northwest. Brief periods of heavy rain are possible, but with the fast motion of these storms wetting rains may be limited. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THURSDAY TO 2 AM PDT FRIDAY... The National Weather Service in Eureka has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 3 PM Thursday to 2 AM PDT Friday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 201, 203, 204, 211, 212, and 283. This includes the communities of Crescent City, Gasquet, Klamath, Orick, Orleans, Hoopa, Willow Creek, Dinsmore, and Hyampom. Areas south of Orick along the coast are NOT included in this warning. * THUNDERSTORMS...Scattered thunderstorms with abundant lightning developing Thursday afternoon, moving north-northwest from Trinity County into northern Humboldt, western Siskiyou, and Del Norte counties. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Erratic outflow wind gusts up to 40 mph. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Hoopa; Lower Middle Klamath; North Coast; Trinity; Upper Smith; Van Duzen, Mad River
